docs.lead_paragraph: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Aug. 20 Families sit in the lobby of the Veterans Administration Hospital, talking quietly to sons or fathers or husbands who are patients here. Nurses move quickly along the halls. Doctors make their rounds. All seems normal.

headline.main: At V.A. Hospital in Michigan, Mysterious Deaths Stir Talk of a 'Poisoner' as the F.B.I. Presses Investigation

docs.abstract: FBI is investigating mysterious deaths of 8 patients and cardiac arrest or collapsed breathing system in some 30 of 300 patients at VA Hosp in Ann Arbor, Mich; use of muscle relaxant drug is suspected (M)
docs.snippet: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Aug. 20 Families sit in the lobby of the Veterans Administration Hospital, talking quietly to sons or fathers or husbands who are patients here. Nurses move quickly along the halls. Doctors make their rounds. All seems normal.

byline.original: By MARTIN WALDRON Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: TRENTON, Aug. 20 (UPI) Drug companies, doctors and dentists, the poor and the elderly today attacked state plans to alter Medicaid services beginning Sept. 1.

headline.main: MEDICAID CHANGES SCORED IN TRENTON; 200 at Hearing Attack New Pricing Rules

docs.abstract: Some 200 opponents of NJ's plans to alter Medicaid services attend hearing of Insts and Agencies Dept; protest proposed 10% reduction in Medicaid fees paid to dentists, proposal that NJ Dental Assn says will force more dentists to drop out of Medicaid program; Dr Robert O Russano of dental assn scores proposal (M)
docs.snippet: TRENTON, Aug. 20 (UPI) Drug companies, doctors and dentists, the poor and the elderly today attacked state plans to alter Medicaid services beginning Sept. 1.

docs.abstract: Lr by Caroline T White suggests lowering income taxes by $30- to 40-billion which Fed Govt collects and turns over to local communities
docs.snippet: Lr by Caroline T White suggests lowering income taxes by $30- to 40-billion which Fed Govt collects and turns over to local communities

docs.lead_paragraph: A three-judge Federal panel yesterday struck down as an unconstitutional invasion of privacy a state law requiring that the names of patients receiving controlled drugs, such as Ritalin, codeine, Percodan and morphine be filed with the state.

headline.main: Court Voids A Drug Log On Patients

docs.abstract: 3-judge Fed panel strikes down on Aug 14 as unconst invasion of privacy NYS law requiring names of patients receiving controlled drugs be filed with state; also finds that law intrudes on dr-patient relationship; panel is composed of Judges Robert L Carter, Wilfred Feinberg and Inzer B Wyatt; decision hailed by NY Civil Liberties Union exec dir Ira Glasser, who notes it does not yet have any immediate impact; NYS Health Dept counsel Donald MacHarg says he does not yet know if decision will be appealed to US Sup Ct (M)
docs.snippet: A three-judge Federal panel yesterday struck down as an unconstitutional invasion of privacy a state law requiring that the names of patients receiving controlled drugs, such as Ritalin, codeine, Percodan and morphine be filed with the state.

keywords.value: THERAPY FOR AND REHABILITATION OF ADDICTS
